verses.roman:
brahma-śāpopasṛṣṭānāṁ
kṛṣṇa-māyāvṛtātmanām
spardhā-krodhaḥ kṣayaṁ ninye
vaiṇavo 'gnir yathā vanam

synonyms: brahma-śāpa—by the curse of the brāhmaṇas; upasṛṣṭānām—who were overtaken; kṛṣṇa-māyā—by the illusory energy of Lord Kṛṣṇa; āvṛta—covered; ātmanām—of those whose minds; spardhā—arising from rivalry; krodhaḥ—the anger; kṣayam—to destruction; ninye—led; vaiṇavaḥ—of bamboo trees; agniḥ—a fire; yathā—as; vanam—the forest.
translation: The violent anger of these warriors, who were overcome by the brāhmaṇas' curse and bewildered by Lord Kṛṣṇa's illusory potency, now led them to their annihilation, just as a fire that starts in a bamboo grove destroys the entire forest.
